thread.title: UP Man Who Is 'Officially Dead', Contesting Election To Prove That He Is Alive! - Indiatimes.com
thread.title_full: UP Man Who Is 'Officially Dead', Contesting Election To Prove That He Is Alive! - Indiatimes.com

title: UP Man Who Is 'Officially Dead', Contesting Election To Prove That He Is Alive! - Indiatimes.com
text:
Indiatimes February 17, 2017 
Santosh Murat Singh, resident of Chitauni village in Varanasi has no political ambitions whatsoever. But he is still contesting the upcoming elections from Shivpur assembly seat to prove a point - he is still alive! 
BCCL 
This is because according to revenue records Singh is dead! 
He says that his cousins 'killed' him using forged documents by to grab land in his village. He is also fighting a legal battle to prove he is "officially alive" and get his name back on his 12.5 acres of ancestral land, which he lost to his cousins. 
He claims he lost the land after his cousins got their names enrolled on the property on the basis of forged documents. Santosh wishes to be the Chief Minister for a day so that he could help all those who are declared dead on land and revenue records on the basis of forged papers and make them "officially alive". 
BCCL 
He wants to help them get their land back. He filed his nomination papers from the Shivpur assembly constituency. Talking to media persons after filing his nomination papers, he said he filed his nomination papers to prove that he is still alive. Don't Miss
